result.execSummary:
The defendant Felix Montenegro-Pastrana was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Felix Montenegro-Pastrana

records.addlTxt: w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk: Amanda. 
Case Called at 9:02 am. 
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo.  Defendant appears, and with Attorney Vanessa Avila.  Interpreter Sally Nichols appears via zoom. 
VRCW. 

Interpreter sworn and interprets. 

Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed.  

State moves to AMEND Ct.1(Battery) to (DC), pursuant to statute 947.01(1) -- otherwise disorderly;

COURT GRANTS ABOVE.

PLEA to Ct.1(DC)>>GUILTY. 

COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding; 
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, a factual basis & defendant guilty;

COURT ORDERS: Pay $10+CC/DNA surcharge and provide sample. 

Adj: 9:19 am.

records.addlTxt: ADA Cody Marschall appears in person; Deft appears in person pro se, Interpreter via phone from SWITS

Pre-trial conference on July 28, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Final pre-trial on August 31, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury Trial on November 29, 2022 at 09:00 am.

No contact with victim(s):  R.M.H.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.

Clerk: Amanda.
Case called at 2:35 pm.
State appears by ADA Cody Marschall. Defendant appears, pro se.  Interpreter appears via zoom. 
Date and Time set for IA; VRCW. 

Interpreter Mriana Kralewski sworn and interprets. 

Reading Waived.  Reserve Jurisdiction. 
Court questions deft re: complaint and rights.
Advised Right of Counsel. 

PLEA:  NOT GUILTY.

COURT ORDERS: $500 signature bond - CONDITIONS: 
- No contact with victim(s): R.M.H. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.
